text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today i'm 
going to share with you my favorite chocolate

cake recipe it is a chocolate zucchini cake with 
white chocolate cream cheese frosting oh it is

so good and it's my favorite for two reasons 
one it is super easy and very forgiving - it

is actually quite healthy as far as cakes go and 
I got this recipe from my best friend's mother

and I've been making it for literally 10 years it 
is that good and today I'm going to share it with

you so let's get started so this recipe makes one 
8 inch round cake okay now what we're going to do

is I've greased this on the side and I'm going 
to line the bottom with parchment paper because

you don't want to have issues with the cake coming 
out okay so a little trick for making round pieces

of parchment paper what I'm going to do is fold 
it into first a square I mean you don't have to

get rid of this part but I like to because it just 
makes it a little easier just like that and then

you have a square with this you're going to keep 
folding it and you keep folding it so that you

keep having this point right here it just fold 
it until it's small like this and then you want

to measure out 1/2 from the center just roughly 
and then right here at the edge then you cut it

off there you go that's fit it all you get this 
perfectly will not perfectly but round enough

piece of parchment paper for the bottom of your 
pan let's do with the dry ingredients so I've

got here - some all-purpose flour now this is 
where the healthy part comes in I modified this

recipe from the original to also include some 
whole wheat flour and I found that I couldn't

barely tell the difference it's actually really 
surprisingly good now we're going to add cocoa

powder and with cocoa powder I like to sieve it 
sift it okay maybe use a bigger sieve I forgot

my big sieve ah because cocoa powder tends to 
have a lot of clumps in it baking powder and

baking soda but I'm also going to sieve these 
especially baking soda because they like to

clump up a little bit of salt and then you're 
just going to give it a whisk so that's the

dry ingredients and now we're going to do our 
white ones I've got some brown sugar in here

dark brown if you don't have you can do light 
brown or even white sugar will work but I do

like that intense molasses flavor some oil now 
you can use any kind of neutral flavored oil I

happen to be using avocado oil I'm just going to 
give it a mix just to break up also the lumps in

brown sugar okay and now I'm going to add two 
eggs but one at a time and goes my second day

okay so you just want to beat it until it's 
sort of like light and you can see lots of air

bubbles a little bit fluffy I've done this with 
just like really whisking vigorously works just

as well now we're going to add some yogurt mini 
spatula to scrape off every last bit especially

thick things like yogurt and vanilla give that 
another were okay so now the healthiest part of

this whole thing the grated zucchini now use the 
large hole grater don't use the tiny tiny little

graders and this is just about one medium sized 
zucchini you should not need more than one case

I'm going to add that into here give it a stir 
hmm if you're not familiar with the concept of

chocolate zucchini cake you actually don't taste 
the zucchini at all but the zucchini will make

the cake incredibly moist without making it dense 
and rich it's really quite amazing okay and now

it's as easy as making a muffin you're going to 
pour the wet into the dry and scrape every last

bit now I'm just going to stir the two together 
you don't want to over mix it however this batter

is actually more forgiving than most cake batters 
in terms of how much you can stir it because the

whole wheat flour will prevent too much gluten 
formations little bran and germ will actually

cut the gluten strands so your cake even if you 
stir it a little bit too much won't be tough okay

so now it's almost mixed but not entirely what 
I'm going to do is stop and scrape my spatula

because what I find is there's always so much 
gunk in here and then I finish doing it and then

suddenly my spatula has all this dry flour stuck 
to it so you want to scrape it before you're done

and then add some chocolate chips so this is the 
secret little secret of this cake is there's tiny

little pleasant surprises all throughout now 
you don't have to do chocolate chips you can do

I wanted to do dried apricots I think that'll be 
really good so we can add whatever you want it's

a really forgiving batter one last stir just 
so you no longer see any dry clumps of flour

and that is it how easy is that so this is going 
to go into a 350 degree oven for about 40 to 45

minutes in the middle rack okay so here is the 
cake I use a toothpick test for this and if you

insert the toothpick and you pull it out and it 
comes out relatively clean it's okay it's such

a moist cake that if it doesn't come out pristine 
dry I find it's okay as long as it's not wet like

you don't see batter on the toothpick now before 
I take this cake out I'm just going to let it cool

and settle down for about five minutes so to get 
this cake out run something flat along the side

of the cake make sure nothing's catching chocolate 
cakes are particularly sticky for some reason okay

and then I'm going to take my cooling rack one two 
three hub and it falls out easily because we put

that parchment paper the perfectly round part of 
parchment paper on the back yay okay the reveal

decision and now we're going to let this cool 
absolutely completely before we put the icing

on it if you put icing on a hot cake even slightly 
warm the icing will just melt okay so the cake is

cool and I can barely contain my excitement I want 
to eat it low bad so we're gonna make the frosting

first though this is a white chocolate cream 
cheese frosting so I've got some cream cheese

and some butter here that has been sitting out 
not too long just until it's soft enough to beat

I don't like it when it's completely you know 
really soft I find the frosting become too too

runny and it's harder to work with so just going 
to beat these two until they're nice and fluffy

okay I'm going to add my melted white chocolate 
so this is just white chocolate that I melted in

the microwave I don't want this super super hot 
because if this is hot it'll melt the butter and

the cream cheese instantly cream cheese butter and 
white chocolate Oh could anything be better and to

scrape it down once or twice and then before I do 
my final mixing I'm going to add icing sugar this

icing is actually not that sweet just a dash of 
vanilla there you go a little bit for good luck

okay but that looks good ready to frost now 
you can turn this recipe into cupcakes if you

want or you can do like a big rectangular 
sheet cake ice them and then cut them into

squares whatever you want okay and then 
before you finish what I like to do is

do a final design on top of the cake by just 
running my spatula back and forth and then

when you do this if there's any part that's 
too thin you'll catch it too because then

you'll be able to see the cake right through 
and then there's that you can leave it just

like this I like to add pistachios on top 
because I love that green color oh my god

check that out I'm so excited ooh I can 
see the melty bits of chocolate chips mmm

I don't even know what to say oh really chocolatey 
I love the melty bits of chocolate chips in there

oh and the it's so moist that's what the 
zucchini does it keeps a cake incredibly

moist yet it is not dense or rich like you 
know a fudge cake might be on that icing

the tartness from the cream cheese just really 
puts it at its happy place nutty pistachios it

is so good so the recipe as always will be on 
hot Thai Kitchen calm when you make it send me

a photo on Facebook Twitter Instagram and if 
you haven't subscribed to the show right here

so you won't miss a single episode and 
I will see you next time for your next

delicious adventure I'm just going to let 
it cool and settle down for about 5 minutes
